content.body: wanderview: if you created a shared or service worker from a document with a nonce, presumably they too should have a nonce?
content.formatted_body: wanderview: if you created a shared or service worker from a document with a nonce, presumably they too should have a nonce?

content.body: annevk: yes, the nonce would propagate and be part of the storage key as well
content.formatted_body: annevk: yes, the nonce would propagate and be part of the storage key as well

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: annevk: yes, the nonce would propagate and be part of the storage key as well
annevk: yes, the nonce would propagate and be part of the storage key as well

content.body: wanderview: I might have misunderstood and thought you were asking if we needed to pass anything on in addition to top-level origin... I think we have some things where we want to use top-level origin as opposed to site, e.g., if we want to disallow something in "third party" documents ideally we'd use cross-origin as a way to determine that. Some of that might be applicable to workers as well, but it's hard to come up with a concrete example
